title: Is it possible to read 4 books in a day? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. When I was fifteen I often read 4 books in a day of binge reading, usually on a Saturday. I would often lie on our blue couch all day and read one book right after the other. I was a fast reader but even more than that, I was hungry for stories. A used paperback novel—a science fiction book or a mystery or a western—cost only about 10 cents in the 1960s. And the library was full of great books you could check out. Gradually, over the decades, I have cultivated the habit of providing my own stories. I now write more and read less than at any time in my life. Part of this is that I find myself to be somewhat less interested now in what other people have to say. My curiosity index has decreased. From about 20 on a scale of 10, I am now down to about a 12. I am not sure whether this is a normal part of the life process, or has to do with the particular times we are living through. Or maybe it’s just me.

So you wanna make some record…!? If yes then go ahead and yes it's quite possible to read 4 or you can even opt for 5 books a day! Reading a book is like talking to its author . We listen to his words . Then we talk to him and he listens in silence . When we read a book we are not merely conversing with the author . We participate in the life described in the book . If the book describes ancient Greece or Rome , we feel that we are in ancient Greece or Rome . The book transports us to the past , and we feel that the ancient heroes are our companions . If the book is a novel , we feel that the characters are our companions . While reading a novel we often identify ourselves with one of the characters, and share his or her experience . Sitting in our own room, we can travel round the world or journey into the past if we have book with us . Thus reading a book is often a journey through space and time . So I would say let's not get into number of books finished in a day rather enjoy each one of them!
